Title: The Two Friends and the Bear

Vocabulary.Climbed: To move upward or go up something like a tree or ladder.
Vocabulary.Smelled: To use the nose to sense odors.
Vocabulary.Danger: The possibility of harm or injury.

Sentences.Text: Two friends were walking in the forest.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the friends will see in the forest?
FunQuestions: Have you walked in a forest?

Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What would you do if you saw a Bear?
FunQuestions: Why do Bears live in forests?

Sentences.Text: One friend quickly climbed a tree to hide.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the friend climbed the tree?

Sentences.Text: The other friend fell to the ground and lay still.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the friend lay still?
FunQuestions: Have you pretended to be still before?
What animals stay still to avoid danger?

Sentences.Text: The Bear came up to him and smelled him.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Bear is going to do next?
FunQuestions: What do you think the Bear smells?

Sentences.Text: The Bear went away because it does not eat dead things.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the Bear left?
FunQuestions: Why do some animals pretend to be dead?

Sentences.Text: The friend in the tree climbed down.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the friend climbed down now?
FunQuestions: What would you say to your friend?
Why do people feel safe after danger is gone?

Sentences.Text: He asked, 'What did the Bear say to you?'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Bear might have said?
FunQuestions: Have you learned a lesson from someone before?
What makes you curious about animals?

Sentences.Text: The other friend answered, 'The Bear told me not to trust a friend who leaves you when danger comes.'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the friend said this?
FunQuestions: Have you been in a tricky situation with a friend?
